page.title: Euro gold and silver commemorative coins (San Marino)

revisions.rev:
{{Refimprove|article|date=August 2011}} {{Infobox Country|maxwidth=250px|width=250px | native_name = {{lang|en|''San Marino''}} | conventional_long_name = San Marino | image_map = Europe location SMO.png }}
This article covers '''euro [[gold]] and [[silver]] commemorative coins''' issued by Azienda Autonoma Di Stato Filatelica E Numismatica. It also covers rare cases of collectors coins (coins not planned for normal circulation) minted using other precious metals. It does not cover either the [[â¬2 commemorative coins|San Marino â¬2 commemorative coins]] or the [[Commemorative coins of San Marino|Sammarinese scudo commemorative coins]].
For euro gold and silver commemorative coins of other countries see [[Euro gold and silver commemorative coins]].
{{See also|Commemorative coins of San Marino}}
==2 Scudo== San Marino has adopted the Euro since 2002 as its currency, However in a means to maintain its own cultural identity it continues to issue a gold commemorative coin in its former currency the scudo released with a value of 2 scudo. Since there is a fixed exchange rate between the scudo and the euro and since the euro is San Marino's official currency the 2 scudo coins will be included in this article.
